Valdés Mas, M

Carballo Alvarez, F

metadata.dc:description: Hepatic hemangioma is the most frequent liver's tumor. The majority are small, asymptomatic and have an excellent prognosis. Those larger than 5 cm can be associated to a consumptive coagulopathy called Kasabach-Merrit syndrome. We present a patient with a giant hepatic hemangioma with multiple hemangimatosis associated to Kasabach-Merrit syndrome.
metadata.dc:title: Hemangioma hepático gigante asociado a síndrome de Kasabach-Merrit.
[Giant hepatic hemangioma associated with Kasabach-Merrit syndrome].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de enfermedades digestivas : organo oficial de la Sociedad Espanola de Patologia Digestiva
